name: 數位華語教學專題研究
description: This course aims at leading students to the field of digital Mandarin teaching through the introduction to the learning theories, hands-on experience in using the state-of-the-art technologies and its application in CFL/CSL teaching, seminar talks, etc. Classes will be blended; a portion of face-to-face instruction will be replaced by web-based online teaching, either synchronous or asynchronous.
goals: Develop students ability to read articles related to digital Chinese language teaching
Enhance students ability to conduct research in digital Chinese language teaching through technologies
syllabus:
**授課方式：****16+2****週**

Week 1    Introduction

Week 2    Learning Theories-1

Week 3    Learning Theories-2

Week 4    COOL Chinese-1

Week 5    COOL Chinese-2

Week 6   COOL Chinese: Teaching Plan Design and Practice

Week 7   Social Media and Apps: Introduction, Literature Review and Report

**Week 8    Tomb Sweeping Day (No Classes)**

Week 9    Social Media and Apps: Teaching Plan Design and Practice

Week 10  Robot Assisted Language Learning (RALL): Introduction, Literature Review and Report

Week 11  RALL: Teaching Plan Design and Practice

Week 12  Google for Education: Introduction, Literature Review and Report

Week 13  Google for Education: Teaching Plan Design and Practice

Week 14  XR: Introduction, Literature Review and Report-1

Week 15  XR: Introduction, Literature Review and Report-2

Week 16  XR: Teaching Plan Design and Practice

Week 17  Seminar Talks Participation-1

Week 18  Seminar Talks Participation-2

methodologies.note: To introduce the basic learning theories and digital tools
To divide students in small groups of 3 or 4 or 5 to (1) read the assigned papers and engage in small group discussion and (2) design the teaching plans
Students work in small groups to present (1) their reading results and (2) their teaching plans

grading.note: Students should actively engage in in-class discussion and participate in the learning activities led by the instructor.
Each group should give oral presentations of their reading results and teaching plans.
